Author: milovsflo
Text: Whatever you do, don’t force her to recover. Don’t force her to get better in a day or even a week. It takes time, and especially she has to WANT to recover. Let her know that you’re there for her and support her as a person. Let her know you’re there for her, but don’t ask her to tell you everything immediately. It’s normal not wanting to talk about it.

Author: livipup
Text: You just kind of have to understand that this is her problem and try not to make it harder for her. You don't want to stress her out over her eating habits because it might backfire and make things worse for her. Just remember that if she were in control it wouldn't be a disorder. Since you've struggled with mental illness before I'm sure you understand that.
